1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
tender (literally or figuratively); by implication, weak
properly, united, i.e. sole; by implication, beloved; also lonely; (feminine) the life (as not to be replaced)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))

4.brief: properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive

5.brief: to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
creation, i.e. (concretely) creatures; also acquisition, purchase, wealth
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own

8.brief: to mound up (especially a turnpike); figurative, to exalt; reflexively, to oppose (as by a dam)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to clasp (the hands or in embrace)

the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
properly, to shield; encompass with; figuratively, to rescue, to hand safely over (i.e. surrender)

10.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a year (as a revolution of time)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)

12.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to press (intransitive), i.e. be narrow; figuratively, be in distress
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall

properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain

illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
